data.title: Visits by Foreign Leaders
data.text: President Mikhail S. Gorbachev Summit meeting in Washington, D.C. and Camp David, Md. Afterwards visited Minneapolis-St. Paul and San Francisco, meeting with South Korean President Roh Tae-woo. Departed the U.S. June 4. May 30–June 3, 1990 President Boris N. Yeltsin Attended U.N. Security Council Summit Meeting in New York City and discussed strategic arms reductions with President Bush at Camp David, Md. January 31–February 1, 1992 Prime Minister Viktor S. Chernomyrdin Met with President Clinton and IMF officials; attended meeting of U.S.-Russian Joint Commission on Economic and Technological Cooperation. Later visited New York City. January 28–February 2, 1996
